title: Blunder in Affirmative Action Case May Cost Harvard $15 Million
description: A missed insurance notice opened a window onto the cost of litigating challenges to race-conscious admissions programs to be heard this month by the Supreme Court.
dc:creator: Adam Liptak
media:credit: Kayana Szymczak for The New York Times
media:description: The Supreme Court will hear arguments in the affirmative action case involving Harvard on Oct. 31.
